history.content: You should take 170 first, because yes it is the core upper div course for pretty much any CS track. It's generally thought to be a pretty difficult course and one of the hardest in the CS track, but you should still take it as early as possible. 161’s may be lighter but its not as core as 170 is; and you may even find 161 to be easier after 170, but not necessarily the other way around, since 170 leans a lot on 61B and 70 (as in there is almost no reviewing of these topics whatsoever, you must be comfortable with proofs, graphs, and select algorithms and data structures from the get-go)--its best to take 170 as soon as you finish these 2 lower div courses.

children.subject: yea, 70 helps for cyptography but don't think any of the 170 stuff was helpful for 161 imo
I wouldn't say 170 helps for 161 at all

Generally, if you aren't sure of what concentration/technology you want to go into in the future, take 170 as it is applicable in a lot of places and is great for prepping for interviews. On the other hand, if you're fascinated by security, take 161 as this may allow you to get your foot in the door for security related internships/jobs early.

history.content: Hi, I'm a sophomore trying to decide between taking 161 and 170 next semester. Which class has the lighter workload? Also, I've heard that CS 170 is a very important class to take early on in the CS path (and 161 is perhaps not so important), but I'm wondering how true that is in others' experiences. Thanks!
history.subject: 161 vs. 170 workload
